steps.text: Dissolve dry yeast and 1 teaspoon of the sugar with 3/4 cups of warm water. Set aside for 10 minutes or until frothy.
Sift flour, salt, remaining sugar, and baking powder into a large, deep bowl.
Add yogurt and olive oil to yeast mixture, stirring to combine.
Pour yeast mixture into the dry ingredients and gently mix with a fork.
When the dough is just about to come together, use your hands to finish mixing.
Keep mixing until it transforms into a soft, slightly sticky, and pliable dough.
Stop kneading when it comes together.
Cover with plastic wrap and let sit in a warm draft-free place for 2-4 hours.
Prepare two bowls - one with flour, another with water.
Separate dough into six equal parts and lightly roll in the flour bowl.
Roll each piece into a teardrop shape 8-9 inches long, 4 inches wide at the widest, and 1/4 inches thick.
Warm a (cast iron) skillet over high heat until nearly smoking (have lid ready).
Gently dampen the dough with your fingertips, then lay it on the skillet.
Cook for about 1 minute (should be a bit blackened) then flip and cover with the lid.
Remove from skillet, brush with melted butter, sprinkle with salt, and place on a towel-lined dish.
